articles.title: Kim Jong Il Issues Order on Raising Military Ranks of KPA Officers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Issues Order on Raising Military Ranks of KPA Officers
yongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il on April 12 issued Order No. 0056 on raising the military ranks of KPA commanding officers.
					 In the order he said that the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK, founded and led by President Kim Il Sung along the road of invincibility, have further developed into the strong army of Mt. Paektu fully pervaded with the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and possessed of the invincible militant might under the Songun leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, displaying to the full matchless heroism in defending the country and building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Expressing firm belief that the KPA commanding officers who have been trained under the care of the Party and the leader would as ever remain loyal to the leadership of the Party and fully discharge their duty in the sacred struggle to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu, he ordered to promote their military ranks on the significant Day of the Sun.
					
					 According to the order, O Il Jong and Hwang Pyong So were promoted to Colonel General, Song Sok Won, Jang Jong Nam and three others to Lieut. General and 38 officers to Maj. General.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to President of Belarus
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to President of Belarus
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Aleksandr Grigoriyevich Lukashenko, president of Belarus, as regards the metro blast in Minsk that claimed heavy casualties.
					Expressing deep condolence and consolation to the president and, through him, to the victims and their families, Kim in the message heartily hoped that the President and the government of Belarus would heal the aftermath of the blast as soon as possible.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Members of Int'l Body
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Members of Int'l Body
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had talks with visiting members of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 They were its Secretary General Vishwanath, director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and Directors Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, and Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Chairman of Int'l Foundation
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets Chairman of Int'l Foundation
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Wednesday met and had a talk with Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, and his party.
					 The chairman said that the foundation will actively cooperate with the Social Scientists Society and other organizations of the DPRK to significantly greet the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chairman of Int'l Foundation
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chairman of Int'l Foundation
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a basket of flowers from Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					The basket was handed over to an official concerned on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Malaysian Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Malaysian Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Wednesday met and had a conversation with the delegation of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia led by Dato Haji Tajuddin Bin Abdul Rahman, member of its Supreme Council.
					The head of the delegation said that his visit to the DPRK provided him with an opportunity to know well about the boundless reverence of the Korean people for President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that he was greatly encouraged by the Korean people working hard for the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Expressing hope that the Korean people would achieve great successes in different fields, he said that his party will boost the exchange with the WPK in the future, too.

articles.title: Gift from Malaysian Party Leader
articles.content:
Gift from Malaysian Party Leader
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor, secretary general of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia.
					 Dato Haji Tajuddin Bin Abdul Rahman, member of the Party's Supreme Council on a visit to the DPRK, conveyed the gift to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Wednesday.

articles.title: Talks Held between WPK Delegations and Malaysian Party
articles.content:
Talks Held between WPK Delegations and Malaysian Party
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia were held here Wednesday.
					 Present there from the WPK side were officials of the C.C., the WPK including Vice Department Director Pak Kun Gwang and from the opposite side members of the delegation led by Dato Haji Tajuddin Bin Abdul Rahman, member of the Party's Supreme Council, and Mohamad Hasril Abdul Hamid, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Malaysian embassy here.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the issues of boosting the relations between the two parties and other issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets French Lawmaker
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets French Lawmaker
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a cordial talk with Jean-Francois Mancel, member of the National Assembly of France from the People's Movement Union, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 He is participating as a guest of honor in the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival under way in the DPRK.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chief of PNA
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chief of PNA 
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan handed the basket over to an official concerned on Wednesday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Vietnamese Ministry of Public Security led by Minister Le Hong Anh, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of Vietnam, arrived here on Wednesday.
					 The DPRK Ministry of People's Security hosted a reception for the delegation.

articles.title: IPC for Commemorating Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth Meets
articles.content:
IPC for Commemorating Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth Meets
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Co-Chairmen of the international preparatory committee Ibrahim Mantu, former deputy president of the Senate of Nigeria, and his party, Yousef Al Amiri, chairman of the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association, and his party, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, Secretaries of the international preparatory committee Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, and Javed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture who is vice-chairman of the Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee, C.P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) who is chairman of the Nepali national preparatory committee, Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women who is chairwoman of the Japanese preparatory committee, and Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain who is chairman of the KFA preparatory committee.
					
					 Also present there were Vice-President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop, co-chairman of the international preparatory committee and chairman of the DPRK preparatory committee, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairwoman of the DPRK preparatory committee, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Mun Jae Chol who is secretary general of the international preparatory committee and the DPRK preparatory committee, and officials concerned. 
					
					 The meeting informed its participants of the organization of national, regional and international preparatory committees to significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun in 2012 and their activities. 
					
					 According to the information, preparatory committees were organized in many countries and regions of the world after the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association in January 2008 called upon the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people to form preparatory committees on the occasion of the centenary of birth of the President and significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun in 2012 through colorful activities including seminar, round-table talks, exhibition and book publication.
					
					 The meeting exchanged views on the tasks before the international preparatory committee and national and regional preparatory committees to glorify 2012 as a year to go down in history along with the august name of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 A resolution of the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee which calls for commemorating in splendor the centenary of birth of the President as the great auspicious event of humankind was adopted.
					
					 The resolution underscored the need for the world progressives and the preparatory committees in various countries to intensify the diverse activities to commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as a great political festival common to mankind and hold an international joint meeting of the hundred-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea in Pyongyang on the Day of the Sun in 2012.
					
					 The resolution also noted that the birthday of Kim Jong Il, the outstanding leader of the human cause of independence in 2012, would be celebrated as a grand international festival.
					
					 It declared they would support and encourage the Korean people in their struggle to translate the desire of the President into reality and build a rich and powerful country.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Letter from Participants in Int'l Meeting
articles.content:
Letter from Participants in Int'l Meeting
						
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a letter on Wednesday from the participants in the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 As the world recognizes, the President is distinguished thinker-theoretician, great statesman, prominent strategist and great sage with noble virtues, the letter said.
					
					 We will coordinate in a unified way the work to successfully carry out the resolution adopted at the consultative meeting and thus make positive contribution to conveying long the personality of the President as a great man who hewed out the human cause of independence and devoted his all to the sacred struggle for building a free and peaceful new world, it said.
					
					 We are convinced that the gate to a thriving nation will be opened in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of the President under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, it said, adding:
					
					 The international preparatory committee will fully discharge its mission and duty by making sure that colorful events praising the greatness and undying feats of the President are held on a worldwide scale with larger attendance.

articles.title: Participants in Int'l Meeting Feted
articles.content:
Participants in Int'l Meeting Feted
						
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung hosted a reception at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Present there on invitation were co-chairmen and secretaries of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of the President, who attended the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairwoman of the DPRK preparatory committee, addressed the reception.
					
					 She said that the recent consultative meeting marked an important occasion in commemorating the centenary of birth of the President as a great auspicious event in the history of mankind.
					
					 The Korean people will advance towards the rosy future of the 21st century together with the peoples of different countries, she added.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, co-chairman of the international preparatory committee, said in his speech that the Juche idea and the Songun politics gripping the hearts of the world people serve as a powerful weapon for frustrating the aggressive moves of the imperialists and building  a new world, free and peaceful.
					
					 He stressed that the revolutionary exploits performed by Kim Il Sung who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country and the realization of the human cause of independence would always shine.
					
					 The international preparatory committee will creditably perform its honorable mission by successfully carrying out the resolution adopted by the consultative meeting, he concluded.

articles.title: Executive Committee of Board of Directors of IIJI Meets
articles.content:
Executive Committee of Board of Directors of IIJI Meets
						
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) --The 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea was held here on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, Kamwiziku Octave, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, other members of the executive committee and foreign delegations and delegates of organizations for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the successes achieved by the organizations for the study of the Juche Idea since the 12th meeting of the executive committee and proposed the orientation of work to be done in the future.
					
					 It also discussed issues of intensifying the activities to study and disseminate the Juche Idea, increasing the number of organizations for the study of the Juche Idea and boosting their function and role.
					
					 It discussed the issues of forming an international preparatory committee for successfully holding a world conference on the Juche idea on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and increasing its role and calling on the members of the organizations for the study of the Juche Idea in the relevant countries and regions to help the preparatory committees creditably perform their mission.
					
					 The meeting underscored the need for the followers of the Juche Idea to organize diverse significant events and widely introduce the immortal feats performed by the peerlessly great men in founding and developing in depth the Juche Idea on the occasion of the Day of the Sun in 2012.
					
					 A resolution of the 13th enlarged meeting was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The resolution called for holding a world conference on the Juche idea with splendor in Pyongyang on the occasion of the Day of the Sun in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					It said that preparations for it would be dynamically pushed forward with main emphasis on making the world conference mark a historic occasion in highly praising Kim Il Sung for his exploits performed in the Korean revolution and in the efforts to accomplish the cause of global independence by founding and developing in depth the Juche idea and in powerfully demonstrating the fact that they are being successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The resolution noted that the organizations for the study of the Juche idea and its followers would intensify their activities to study and disseminate the Juche idea in their regions and countries to stir up an international atmosphere of significant commemorations of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					  A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Letter from Participants in IIJI Meeting
articles.content:
Letter from Participants in IIJI Meeting
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Wednesday received a letter from the participants in the 13th Enlarged Meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 The birth of the Juche idea by President Kim Il Sung made it possible for the progressive humankind to have the man-centered idea at last, and this brought about a historic turn in the development of human thought, the letter said.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's idea and leadership are ones of the President and there opened a bright prospect of the revolutionary cause of Juche, it pointed out.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the President's revolutionary idea as the integrated Juche system of idea, theory and method, it noted, and went on:
					
					 It is thanks to Kim Jong Il that the Juche idea is rapidly disseminating to all countries as the universal idea of the world.
					
					 The gate to a thriving socialist nation will be surely opened in 2012.
					
					 The letter said that with his Songun politics he resolutely frustrated the enemy's moves to stifle the DPRK, protected the peace in Asia and the rest of the world and fully demonstrated the might of single-minded unity.
					
					 Songs in praise of the Juche idea are now resounding in different continents of the world, it noted, adding:
					
					 It is the unanimous desire of the Juche idea followers of different countries to significantly hold the World Conference on Juche Idea, with the Day of the Sun in 2012 as an occasion, in Pyongyang.

articles.title: 13th Kimilsungia Festival Opens
articles.content:
13th Kimilsungia Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The 13th Kimilsungia Festival was opened with due ceremony here on Wednesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					On display at its venue are nearly 20,000 potted flowers in praise of the great man presented by armed forces organs, ministries, national institutions and many other units, soldiers, working people of different strata and school youth and children of the DPRK, the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and overseas compatriots, embassies of different countries and missions of international organizations here, friendship and solidarity organizations and personages of various countries, members of the associations for supporting the propagation of immortal flowers in different countries and Chinese residents in the DPRK with their sincerity.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop and officials of ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations, soldiers and working people, and overseas Koreans delegations and overseas compatriots.
					
					 Present on invitation were an Indonesian government cultural delegation led by Hari Untoro Dradjat, senior advisor for multiculture of the Ministry of Culture and Tourism, Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Nasri Gustaman and his embassy officials and other foreign guests.
					
					 An Tong Chun, DPRK minister of Culture, said in his opening address that this festival would display the faith and will of the Korean army and people to hold the President in high esteem for all ages and work hard for building a thriving nation and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. It will also show the unbounded reverence of all people for the President, peerlessly great man, he added.
					
					 Hari Untoro Dradjat made a congratulatory speech. Kimilsungia has become a pride of the Korean nation and a symbol of the eternal relations of friendship between Indonesia and the DPRK since President Sukarno presented this newly-bred flower to President Kim Il Sung, he said.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Venue of 13th Kimilsungia Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Venue of 13th Kimilsungia Festival
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the venue of the 13th Kimilsungia Festival on Wednesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The visitors looked round with deep emotion potted Kimilsungias that came to full bloom with boundless reverence of the Korean people and the world progressives.
					
					 They made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Flower Named after President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Flower Named after President Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The 13th Kimilsungia Festival is going on in Pyongyang to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 Kimilsungia is associated with the Indonesian people's deep reverence for him.
					
					 When visiting Indonesia, Kim Il Sung was guided to the Bogor Botanical Garden on April 13, Juche 54 (1965). Sukarno briefed him on a flower bred by an Indonesian botanist and suggested naming it after the DPRK President.
					
					 Kim Il Sung politely declined the suggestion, saying he had no particular reason for it.
					
					 But Sukarno told him that he deserved it for his great contribution to humankind. 
					
					 Finding it difficult to decline any more, Kim Il Sung said he would accept the suggestion as a token of the Indonesian people's admiration for the Korean people.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting of Workers Held
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting of Workers Held
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- An oath-taking meeting of trade union members and other workers in the DPRK took place in front of the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill Wednesday to commemorate the 99th anniversary of his birth.
					 The participants in the meeting laid floral baskets and flowers before the statue and made deep bows to it.
					
					 Led by Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, they made a pledge to hold Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the sun of Juche forever and surely build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation in Korea true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They expressed the resolution to adhere to the revolutionary idea and exploits of Kim Il Sung and creditably implement his behests.
					
					 They stressed the need for all the trade union members and other workers to become staunch fighters devotedly defending the leader and the ardent followers and strict carriers of the Songun idea of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Attending the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, trade union officials and members and other workers.

articles.title: Women's Union Members Commemorate Day of Sun
articles.content:
Women's Union Members Commemorate Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- An art performance of women's union members "We Will Always Sing the Song of Sun under the Guidance of the Great General" took place here on Wednesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Its numbers included "We Will Always Live with the Leader," "The Father of People" and "The Victory of Revolution Is in Sight." 
					
					 The audience expressed great admiration for a short play "My Wife" and duet "My Daughter-in-Law" that show the Korean women's honor and pride of leading a happy life as the flower of the country and the flower of family. 
					
					 Quintet "Ninani Nanno of Happiness" and drum and chorus "A Thriving Nation Is in Sight" gave the audience confidence in tomorrow when all ideals of the people will come to reality.
					
					 The performance was enjoyed by Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, and officials and members of the union in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Art Festival Participants Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Art Festival Participants Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Artistes of different countries and overseas Korean artistes participating in the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Wednesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					 They made bows to the President who wisely led the struggle of the world people for independence, peace and friendship and clearly indicated the way for development of genuine arts reflecting the aspiration of the popular masses.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Statue of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Statue of Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill was visited Wednesday by the participants in the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of the President and the economic and commercial councilors corps here.
					 The visitors laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statue and paid homage to the President with boundless reverence for him.
					
					 Meanwhile, a floral basket was sent to the statue by the Switzerland-Korea Committee. Chairman Martin Lotscher on a visit to the DPRK laid the floral basket before the statue on Wednesday.

articles.title: Congratulations from Diplomatic Corps
articles.content:
Congratulations from Diplomatic Corps
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Russian Ambassador Valery Sukhinin, doyen of the corps, handed the basket and letter over to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Ostrich Farm in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Ostrich Farm in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps here visited the Ostrich Farm on the outskirts of Pyongyang on Wednesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The visitors went round corrals standing in a row, the ostrich meat processing factory, etc., being briefed on the fact that the farm was built into a big comprehensive stockbreeding centre. 
					
					 They expressed admiration at the farm, looking over the panoramic view of it turned into thick woodland and greenery and its cozy and cultured production structures.

articles.title: Officials of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Officials of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front Wednesday visited Mangyongdae on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary life of the President and the Mangyongdae family at his native home there, they looked round carefully-preserved relics with keen interest.
					
					 We feel stronger yearning for the President, visiting his birthplace in Mangyongdae with the April spring holiday as an occasion, Jo said, adding:
					
					 It is the greatest honor and fortune of our nation to hold the President, prominent great man, in high esteem.
					
					 He dedicated his all to the happiness of the people and national reunification.
					
					 His great feats for the country and the nation, the times and mankind will remain long.
					
					 The vanguard fighters of the AINDF and the people from all walks of life in south Korea will more vigorously struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country so ardently desired by the President.

articles.title: Joint and Separate Performances for April Art Festival Given
articles.content:
Joint and Separate Performances for April Art Festival Given
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival is going on before full houses every day.
					 Joint and separate performances were given at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre, the Ponghwa Art Theatre, the Moranbong Theatre, the Pyongyang Grand Theatre and the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday.
					
					 In symphony "DPRK-China Friendship Will Be Everlasting" the performers of the Jilin Provincial Symphony Orchestra showed well the will of the two peoples to glorify generation after generation the history of friendship between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung together with Chinese revolutionaries of elder generation.
					
					 Artistes of the Xiamen Xiaobailu Folk Dance Troupe of China gave a successful presentation of various dances through dynamic rhythms, witty skills and humorous expression.
					
					The Dance Troupe of the Kiev Dance Theatre and the "Step-Class" Dance Troupe of Ukraine represented numbers rich in national flavor and unique rhythms to draw attention of the audience.
					
					 The Merited Artist Varvara and Ensemble "Oberg" of Russia displayed songs, dances and other numbers.
					
					 The Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan put on the stage numbers reflecting the faith of the officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan to devote themselves to strengthening Chongryon, cherishing the spirit of the nation.
					
					 The performers of the Art Troupe of Koreans in China impressively sang male solo "Changsong Today", female solo "My Wife" and mixed duet "Song of Girl".
					
					 The festival performance goes on.

articles.title: New Building of Kim Il Sung University Completed
articles.content:
New Building of Kim Il Sung University Completed
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Building No. 3 has been built at Pyongyang College of Medicine under Kim Il Sung University.
					 Total plottage of the building is more than 10,000 square meters, and it has lecture rooms of several faculties, laboratories, etc. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited the college several times right after the liberation of the country and taught that excellent building be built in the future. In the postwar period he wisely led the work to construct more modern building.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the college in November last year to clearly indicate the way to be followed by it and took measures to finish the construction of new building as soon as possible.
					
					 A ceremony of commissioning the building took place Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Song Ja Rip, president of Kim Il Sung University and concurrently minister of Higher Education, and others.

articles.title: Light Industry Factories under Construction in Rason
articles.content:
Light Industry Factories under Construction in Rason
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Light industry districts are taking shape in the Rason Economic and Trade Zone in the northern part of the DPRK.
					Production is going well at the already built light industry factories in the zone.
					
					 More factories are now under construction in some areas of the zone.
					
					 Ri Chol Su, director of the Rason Industrial Company, told KCNA that the zone has favorable conditions for becoming a production and trade hub.
					
					 He said the company plans to build high-tech light industry factories.
					
					 It has updated garment, foodstuff, daily necessities, footwear, packing and other factories and increased their production capacity, he said, adding:
					
					 Most of their products are exported to other countries to enjoy popularity. 
					
					 It has launched joint ventures with Chinese businesses.
					
					 Businesses of other countries are interested in investing in the company.
					
					 The company will play a big role in turning the zone into a comprehensive production and trade base.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Honored with Generalissimo Title
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Honored with Generalissimo Title
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was awarded the title of the DPRK generalissimo this day 19 years ago.
					 The title reflects the Korean people's heartfelt gratitude for his distinguished services to defending the country and people.
					
					 In his lifetime he always paid primary attention to military affairs.
					
					 Deeply aware that the sovereignty and dignity of the nation could be safeguarded only by dint of arms, he founded a guerilla army to launch a war against the Japanese imperialist aggressors and finally accomplished the historical cause of national liberation.
					
					 After the victory in the anti-Japanese war, he developed the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into regular armed forces and defeated the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					
					 His brilliant commanding art and unique tactics were fully demonstrated in the war.
					
					 After the ceasefire he successfully frustrated all the aggressive moves of the enemies, creditably defending the sovereignty of the country and strengthening the armed forces.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Issue of International Nuclear Proliferation
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Issue of International Nuclear Proliferation
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Vertical nuclear proliferation spurs the transverse nuclear proliferation and even the influence of the vertical nuclear proliferation on the regional and world security is increasing, still remaining the biggest hurdle in the way of preserving the world nuclear non-proliferation regime.
					 This is the main tenor of an article dealing with the issue of international nuclear proliferation carried by No. 6 issue of the Chinese magazine "World Affairs."
					
					 The article titled "The nuclear weapons of the DPRK at a turning point. The issue of vertical and transverse nuclear non-proliferation hard to solve" said:
					
					 The nuclear issue of the DPRK, in essence, reflects a difficult issue in normalizing the relations between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 In the gambling of the DPRK and the U.S. over the nuclear issue, the DPRK has guaranteed its existence with nuclear weapons and pursued development, proceeding from its security need and, at the same time, handled it in a tactical manner, consistently maintaining a clear thread of connection.
					
					 The guarantee of the existence was the main motive of the DPRK in seeking access to nuclear weapons. The DPRK and the U.S. are the sworn enemies each other and the former is exposed to constant threat from the latter. The U.S. threatened more than once to use nukes against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. listed the DPRK as part of an "axis of evil" at the end of the Cold War and had already worked out an operational plan against the DPRK. The joint military exercises of the U.S. and south Korea targeted against the DPRK have never ceased. Their number has noticeably increased in recent years. 
					
					 Such poor security environment required the DPRK to guarantee its existence as a sovereign state with nuclear weapons.
					
					 The world nuclear non-proliferation regime has faced an increasing blatant challenge since the demise of the Cold War.
					
					 The world nuclear proliferation has witnessed the steady emergence of two tendencies: obvious transverse and vertical proliferation.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the number of new nuclear weapons states or countries and anti-government entities which acquired nuclear capability is on the steady increase besides the five nuclear weapons states allowed to possess nukes under the NPT. And the nuclear race is ceaselessly escalating among the universally recognized nuclear weapons states.  
					
					 Typical of the vertical nuclear proliferation is the nuclear race escalating between the U.S. and Russia, the two nuclear superpowers, in a sustainable manner.
					
					 The new Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty concluded between them which can serve as the only means for making substantial progress in the building of a world without nukes is no more than a drop in the ocean.
					
					 They still have an absolute majority of nuclear weapons while steadily increasing the investment in improving them. Nuclear weapons are regarded as something indispensable in the national security strategy and the said nuclear powers remain basically unchanged in their confrontational nuclear posture based on the Cold War.
					
					 It is against this backdrop that it is not hard to understand that the DPRK is by no means the country to which the above-said non-proliferation regime should pay attention. The proliferation getting evermore distinct in Israel, Iran, India, Pakistan, south Korea, Japan and other countries proves that nuclear proliferation is not confined to the existing nuclear issue and complicated political and security interests are lurking behind it. 
					
					 A proof of this is that the lune field of world transverse nuclear proliferation clashes with the instable lune zone of world security.
					
					 The international community, nuclear powers, in particular, should make substantial efforts to successfully handle the issue of vertical nuclear proliferation and, at the same time, properly solve the issue of transverse nuclear proliferation.
					
					 This is the key to preserving the world nuclear non-proliferation regime and attaining the noble goal to build a world without nukes.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slashes at US Invariable Ambition for Preemptive Nuclear Attack
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slashes at US Invariable Ambition for Preemptive Nuclear Attack
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has ceaselessly conducted interceptor missile test-fires under the pretext of coping with the "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK. It had a meeting of the "extended deterrence policy committee" with the south Korean puppet forces at which they agreed to intensify the research for military cooperation against the DPRK. 
					 This cannot be interpreted otherwise than a serious development as it proves that the U.S. remains unchanged in its scenario for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 It is against the backdrop of such moves of the U.S. that forces hostile to the DPRK are becoming increasingly assertive for working out extended deterrence strategy in the East Asian region including the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 At a recent symposium sponsored by the Carnegie International Peace Foundation of the U.S., a professor of Keio University of Japan said that extended deterrence is part of the U.S nuclear strategy, adding that the redrafting of the plan for extended deterrence by the U.S and south Korea would play an important role in coping with someone's "provocation."
					
					 The true colors of a robber can never change.
					
					 The U.S. and other warlike forces are playing camouflaged peace tactics. They are strengthening nuclear cooperation under the pretext of the fictitious "threat" from the DPRK, talking about "detente" on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 In this regard, it is worth recalling the remarks made by the U.S. chief executive in Prague in April of 2009 that the U.S. would steadily maintain effective deterrence for itself and its allies.
					
					 The U.S. elaborated long ago on the contents of the "extended deterrence" like "nuclear umbrella" and the missile defence system it offered to south Korea and Japan, while talking about "coping with" someone's "nuclear threat." 
					
					 Through this, the U.S. is retaining a tighter grip on south Korea and Japan as its advance bases for its preemptive nuclear attack and rounding off the preparations for a war of aggression against the DPRK. 
					
					 The reality compels the DPRK to boost its war deterrence. 
					
					 It is a legitimate exercise of the right to self-defence, in every aspect, for the DPRK to bolster its war deterrence to protect the supreme interests and security of the country from the reckless moves of the hostile forces for aggression.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Japanese Reactionaries' Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Japanese Reactionaries' Claim to Tok Islets 
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- It was recently reported that the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan made public the results of the screening and passing of new textbooks. According to it, the ministry decided to describe Tok Islets as "part of Japan's territory" in 12 kinds of sociology textbooks for middle schools of Japan. Meanwhile, Japanese Foreign Minister Matsumoto blustered that the government has a consistent stand that Tok Islets are "part of Japan's territory". He went the lengths of talking nonsense that Japan would consider a missile attack on Tok Islets from outside as one on its own territory, describing them as part of its territory.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: The Japanese reactionaries' bid to grab Tok Islets is an unpardonable grave provocation as it is a wanton violation of the sovereignty of Korea. 
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea as they do not allow anyone to eye or invade, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Japan's moves to seize Tok Islets were prompted not by any ignorance of international law or geographical conception or misunderstanding of historical facts but they proceeded from its wild ambition for grabbing them. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries seek to make the islets a dispute, insisting that they are part of Japan's "territory," and occupy them in a bid to use them as a springboard from which to realize their scenario for reinvading Korea and the rest of Asia and, at the same time, establish a monopoly over the economic concessions including rich marine and seabed resources around the islets. 
					
					 By teaching the Japanese youngsters and other people distorted history they seek to implant the militarist idea into their minds and use them as a shock brigade for grabbing Tok Islets and reinvading Asia. 
					
					 What matters is that all these actions are being openly and systematically staged under the direct wire-pulling of the Japanese government. 
					
					 Japan is busy seeking territorial aggrandizement instead of minding its own business though it is now under an emergency situation. The Japanese authorities would be well advised to bear in mind that this would only bring to light their inveterate aggressive nature and invite rebuff and criticism from the international community.

articles.title: Actions against Authorities' Unpopular Rule Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Authorities' Unpopular Rule Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions at a meeting in Pusan on April 8 called for actions against the authorities' unpopular rule.
					 Speakers at the meeting recalled that it is 110 days since the members of the Trade Union of Hanjin Heavy Industries launched a general strike in protest against the management side's unreasonable dismissal under the pretext of adjustment. 
					
					 They accused the capitalists of working hard to more harshly fleece the workers while the authorities are making desperate efforts to stamp out their union.
					
					They declared that all the workers would stage united actions for the repeal of the evil law on labor, a halt to the above-said discharge and a pay raise.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand Democracy
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand Democracy 
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations including the April 9 Reunification and Peace Foundation, a juridical body, held a memorial service in Seoul on April 9 for pro- reunification activists killed due to the conspiratorial case cooked up by the erstwhile military fascist dictatorial regime.
					 Recalling that several persons were punished on charges of involvement in the case of the People's Revolutionary Party 36 years ago, the speakers deplored that the authorities have not made any official apology to the dead though many years have passed since then.
					
					 A democratic society should be built on this land to realize the desire of the victims, they held.

articles.title: Earthquake Occurs in S. Korea
articles.content:
Earthquake Occurs in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with magnitude 3.1 Monday jolted the sea area 16 kilometers away southeast of Kangrung City in south Korean Kangwon Province, according to an MBC report.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded Abroad
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Personages of a regional body and Italy issued statements to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 Kamwiziku Octave, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a statement on Apr. 4 said that Kim Il Sung is the benefactor of all people as he embarked on the road of revolution in his early years, founded the Juche idea and put forward the working popular masses as the driving forces of history. 
					
					 He is not only the great master in ideology and theory but also the invincible and iron-willed commander and the benevolent father of all people, the statement said, expressing the will to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.
					
					 The organizational secretary of the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy in a statement on March 31 praised Kim Il Sung as the eternal president of the DPRK and an elder statesman of the world who made undying contribution to the human cause of independence. The statement highly appreciated the feats he performed in building the party, army and state.
					
					 Chairman of the NDC Kim Jong Il has guided the Korean people to victory with his Songun revolutionary leadership in order to achieve national reunification and build a great prosperous and powerful nation as desired by the President, it added.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Commemorated Abroad
						
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- A regional body and Finnish and Nigerian organizations posted special write-ups and articles on their Internet homepages on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on April 2 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Juche-oriented way of settling all national issues" with a photo showing the President conducting external activities.
					
					 The article said the President made it clear that the national issue is, in essence, one of achieving and protecting the independence of the nation.
					
					 On the same day the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet homepage an article praising Kim Jong Il for having wisely led the army and people of the DPRK with his original Songun politics.
					
					 The article noted: The Finnish followers of the Juche idea extend full support to Kim Jong Il's Songun politics and express belief that the Korean people will register great achievements in building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on March 31 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il and Invincible Korean People's Army".

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Observed Overseas
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Observed Overseas
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries from March 28 to April 1 on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 They included a seminar on the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and a book and photo exhibition in Italy, a seminar in Nigeria and a film show in Ethiopia.
					
					 On display in the venue of the exhibition were works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and books and photos introducing the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification.
					
					 The director of the International Department of the Communist Party of Italy said that successes made in the DPRK have instilled great confidence and courage into the world people struggling for justice and progress.
					
					 He noted that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people are winning one victory after another in the confrontation with the imperialists under the uplifted banner of socialism, the director added that this is thanks to the Juche idea founded by the President and the solid foundation of the self-supporting national economy provided by him and the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies stressed that the Juche idea is the one of setting store by a country and nation and a great guiding idea in the present era clearly indicating the way of dynamically advancing the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nepal
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The Study Forum for Self-Reliance and the Women's Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Nepal jointly printed General Secretary Kim Jong Il's Work "Let Us Brilliantly Carry Forward and Develop the Revolutionary Traditions of Juche".
					 The work, published on December 5, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the idea that to defend and carry forward the revolutionary traditions of the Workers' Party of Korea is sure guarantee for advancing to victory and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche. It indicates tasks for resolutely defending and steadily carrying forward and developing the revolutionary traditions. 
					
					 A ceremony of releasing the book took place in Katmandu on April 6.

articles.title: Accident at Nuclear Power Plant of Japan Put at Worst Level
articles.content:
Accident at Nuclear Power Plant of Japan Put at Worst Level 
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) --The nuclear crisis at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan is getting more serious. 
					 The Japanese Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry on April 12 decided to raise the severity level of the accident at the power plant to 7, the highest in history, on an international scale from the current 5.
					
					 This decision was made in connection with the unprecedentedly huge leakage of radioactive materials inside the country due to the killer quake on March 11, the Kyodo News reported.
					
					 International concern about it is increasing. 
					
					 A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference urged Japan to quickly and accurately inform various countries of the world of the leakage of radioactive materials. 
					
					 The New York Times pointed out that the Japanese government's reaction to the nuclear crisis was slow. German media said the Japanese Nuclear Power Plant was at the same worst level as the tragedy in Chernobyl. 
					
					 Aftershocks are going on in Japan. 
					
					 The Japan National Police Agency announced that the death toll increased to 13 333 and the number of those unaccounted for to 15 150 as of 10 a.m. Wednesday. 
					
					 Magnitude 6.3 and 5.5 quakes jolted Fukushima and Nagano prefectures on Tuesday. 
					
					 The Japanese Meteorological Agency said there were 408 aftershocks of magnitude of more than 5.0 as of 8 a.m. on Tuesday in the wake of massive quake on March 11.

articles.title: Quake Hits Southern Kurils of Russia
articles.content:
Quake Hits Southern Kurils of Russia
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.3 on the Richter Scale jolted the southern Kurils of Russia on April 9.
					 Its epicenter was in the water area 110 kilometers away east of Shikotan Island.

articles.title: China Seeks to Ban Import of More Kinds of Japan's Agricultural Products
articles.content:
China Seeks to Ban Import of More Kinds of Japan's Agricultural Products
						
 Beijing, April 11 (KCNA) -- The State General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine of China on April 8 announced a notice that it would expand kinds of foodstuffs and agricultural products it banned import from Japan and scope of producers and strengthen the supervision over inspection and quarantine.
					 This step was taken in connection with the fact that the radioactive leakage from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan is steadily affecting the quality security of foodstuffs and agricultural products and its damage is getting serious.

articles.title: China Launches Satellite for Indigenous Global Navigation
articles.content:
China Launches Satellite for Indigenous Global Navigation
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- China on Sunday successfully launched its eighth orbiter which will form part of its indigenous satellite-navigation and -positioning network.
					 A Long March-3A carrier rocket carrying the "Beidou," or Compass, navigation satellite took off on Sunday morning from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center.

articles.title: China Tries to Intensify Party Work in Army
articles.content:
China Tries to Intensify Party Work in Army
 Beijing, April 11 (KCNA) -- The party committees of the Chinese army have conducted an education and clearage campaign for strengthening the party members' mental culture and improving their ideological style since February.
					 The committees at all levels are organizing the work down to the detail in keeping with their own specific conditions and, at the same time, leading the senior party members to take an active part in the campaign while acting as one in ideology under the important instructions of President Hu Jintao and the assignment given by the Central Military Commission.

articles.title: China to Strengthen Work in Field of Politics and Law
articles.content:
China to Strengthen Work in Field of Politics and Law
 Beijing, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Central Commission of Politics and law of China instructed relevant organs to conduct an education and action campaign under the theme of displaying the traditions, hardening the faith and implementing the laws for the people for one year. 
					 Through this campaign, those organs are to concentrate efforts on hardening the ideal and faith of policemen in the field of the politics and law, keeping closer contact with the masses and solving the serious problems in the field of law execution.

articles.title: Method to Enforce Rules on Upright and Honest Work Made Public in China
articles.content:
Method to Enforce Rules on Upright and Honest Work Made Public in China 
						
 Beijing, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China recently made public "the method to enforce some rules that require the leading members of the CPC to work uprightly and honestly."
					 A senior official of the Commission said that the announcement of the method to enforce the rules that made their provisions more specific and clear-cut is of every weighty significance in further accelerating the construction of the anti-corruption and upright system, stepping up the building of the ranks of cadres and preserving the purity and the progressive nature of the party.

articles.title: Pakistani President Seeks Regional Anti-Terror Cooperation
articles.content:
Pakistani President Seeks Regional Anti-Terror Cooperation
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari, in a diplomatic talk on April 9, called for regional cooperation in the struggle against terrorism.
					 He said that regional cooperation and establishment of trans-national linkages is essential for fighting terrorism in the South Asian region.

articles.title: Brazilian President on Role of BRICS
articles.content:
Brazilian President on Role of BRICS
						
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff referred to the role of the BRICS in a recent interview. 
					 Praising the BRICS as an "extremely healthy" presence which has become one of the levers of multilateralism in the world, she said that it would continue to make a great contribution to the world. 
					
					 The BRICS has the vision that a new economic order is important, Rousseff said, stressing that the world is no longer the world of Group of 8 but the world of Group of 20.

articles.title: Jordan Condemns Israeli Attacks on Gaza
articles.content:
Jordan Condemns Israeli Attacks on Gaza
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Jordan's Foreign Minister Nasser Judeh on April 9 condemned the Israeli military attack on Gaza Strip of Palestine.
					 Condemning the Israeli escalation of military attacks on Gaza Strip that claimed the lives of innocent Palestinians including children, he urged the Israeli authorities to immediately halt all military actions.
					
					 He also called upon the international community to take tangible and swift steps to realize the desired objective to create an independent and viable Palestinian state at the borders of 1967.

articles.title: Demonstrators Decry USTroops in Baghdad
articles.content:
Demonstrators Decry US Troops in Baghdad
						
 Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Tens of thousands of Iraqi people staged a demonstration in Baghdad on April 9, demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. troops.
					 The protesters carried Iraqi flags and banners, chanting such slogans as "America Get Out!" and "No for Occupation, No for America."
					
					 On the same day there were similar demos in other cities of Iraq.

articles.title: International Day of Human Space Flight Instituted
articles.content:
International Day of Human Space Flight Instituted
Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The UN General Assembly adopted a resolution on instituting International Day of Human Space Flight on April 7.
					 The resolution said that April 12 is set as International Day of Human Space Flight to commemorate the start of the space era for humankind. This day will be celebrated internationally every year, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ordena elevar grados de comandantes del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il ordena elevar grados de comandantes del EPC
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- El Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, Kim Jong Il, emitió el día 12 la orden no. 0056 para ascender los grados militares de los miembros de mando del EPC.
					Las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias de Corea, fundadas y conducidas siempre a la victoria por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, se fortalecieron bajo la dirección del Songun del Partido del Trabajo de Corea como invencible ejército revolucionario del monte Paektu en que reina la disposición de defender al líder a costa de vida, destaca la orden y prosigue que ellas luchan hoy con heroísmo incomparable por defender la patria y construir una gran potencia próspera socialista.
					
					Convencido de que los miembros de mando del EPC, crecidos en el regazo del partido y el líder, seguirán apoyando con fidelidad la dirección del partido y cumpliendo su deber en la sagrada lucha por llevar a feliz término la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en el monte Paektu, ordeno elevar sus grados militares con motivo del significativo Día del Sol (15 de abril, día de nacimiento del Presidente), acota.
					
					Según la orden, O Il Jong y Hwang Pyong So recibieron el grado de coronel general y Song Sok Won, Jang Jong Nam y otros 3, el de teniente general.
					
					Además, 38 se hicieron mayor generales.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Mahmoud Abbas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Mahmoud Abbas
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente  Kim Jong Il recibió el cesto de flores que con motivo del Día del Sol (15 de abril), le dirigiera el jefe de la Autoridad Nacional de Palestina, Mahmoud Abbas.
					El embajador palestino en Corea, Ismael Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, lo entregó este miércoles a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Inaugurado XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
Inaugurado XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedó inaugurado el día 13 en esta capital el XIII Festival de Kimilsungias en homenaje al día de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					  En la sede se veían casi 20 mil ejemplares de Kimilsungia exhibidas por numerosas unidades como las instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, ministerios y órganos centrales, militares del Ejército Popular de Corea, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jóvenes y niños escolares de Corea, el Presidium del Comité Central de la Asociación General de Coreanos Residentes en Japón (Chongryon) y otros coreanos en ultramar, las representaciones diplomáticas de varios países y las oficinas de organizaciones internacionales en Corea, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad y personalidades de otros países, los miembros de la asociación de ayuda de propaganda de la flor inmortal y chinos residentes en Corea.
					
					  En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, los funcionarios de los ministerios, órganos centrales y entidades de masas, militares del EPC, trabajadores de distintos sectores, las delegaciones y coreanos en ultramar que vinieron individualmente o formando delegación.
					
					  Entre los invitados se veían la delegación cultural gubernamental de la República de Indonesia encabezada por el asistente del ministro de Cultura y Turismo, Hari Untoro Dradjat, el embajador Nasri Gustaman y otros miembros de la embajada indonesia en Corea y otros huéspedes extranjeros.
					
					  El ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun en su discurso inaugural dijo que el festival demostrará la convicción y la voluntad de todo el ejército y el pueblo de enaltecer siempre al Presidente y cumplir la causa de construcción de la gran potencia próspera y la revolucionaria del Juche bajo la guía del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y testimoniará la gran veneración de toda la humanidad al Presidente     Kim Il Sung, gran hombre sin par. 
					
					Al pronunciar la palabra de felicitación, Hari Untoro Dradjat, recordó que el ex Presidente indonesio Sukarno obsequió a Su Excelencia el Presidente Kim Il Sung esa flor cultivada nuevamente en aquel tiempo. 
					
					Desde entonces, Kimilsungia deviene el orgullo de la nación coreana y el símbolo de la amistad eterna entre Indonesia y Corea, apuntó.

articles.title: Tiene lugar segundo contacto Norte-Sur sobre actividad volcánica
articles.content:
Tiene lugar segundo contacto Norte-Sur sobre actividad volcánica
						
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 12 en Kaesong el segundo contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para la investigación conjunta de actividades volcánicas del monte Paektu.
					En la ocasión, la parte Norte volvió a enfatizar que el propósito del contacto está en debatir los problemas de trabajo para impulsar la investigación conjunta sobre actividades volcánicas del monte Paektu.
					
					Al presentar el proyecto sobre el seminario académico de ese tema, la fecha, lugar, dimensión, forma y contenido del recorrido en el terreno que se necesita, etc. propuso aprobar un acuerdo sobre el particular.
					
					Si bien dijo estar de acuerdo en la necesidad de investigación conjunta, la parte Sur planteó la absurda iniciativa de dilatar el seminario académico por más de 2 años y medio mencionando el llamado "modo de acercamiento", "principios" y "planes por etapas" y alegando que la investigación previa demora un semestre y la principal requiere de más de 2 años.
					
					E insistió obstinadamente en que se le entregue primero los datos de síntomas de erupción volcánica del monte Paektu.
					
					Tras cuestionar fuertemente la injusta conducta de la parte Sur, la parte Norte volvió a demandarle la aceptación del borrador de proyecto referido explicando que el intercambio de datos se realizará automáticamente cuando haya el seminario y el recorrido en el terreno.
					
					Sin embargo, la parte Sur se obstinó en su demanda por varias horas y dificultó intencionalmente el contacto presentando la llamada "nota de entendimiento" que enumeraba aburridamente el llamado "modo de acercamiento", "principios" y "planes por etapas" sin fuerza restrictiva.
					
					Al ver que no podría salir con la suya y recaía sobre sí misma la responsabilidad del fracaso de contacto, la parte Sur se retiró de la sede de negociaciones.
					
					Luego, volvió a aparecer y firmó a desganas el acuerdo presentado por la parte Norte tras demorar 4 horas recibiendo las órdenes de las autoridades de Seúl.
					
					El acuerdo establece que a partir del entendimiento común sobre la investigación conjunta de erupciones volcánicas del monte Paektu, ambas partes coreanas acordaron cooperar para auspiciar el seminario académico a principios de mayo en Pyongyang u otro lugar conveniente y realizar el recorrido conjunto en el terreno a mediados de junio y decidieron debatir los problemas detallados de trabajo.

articles.title: Se forman repartos de industria ligera en Rason
articles.content:
Se forman repartos de industria ligera en Rason
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Últimamente, se crean en la zona económica y comercial de Rason de Corea los repartos de industria ligera.
					Ya se dinamiza la producción en las fábricas de mediano y pequeño tamaños desplegadas en algunos repartos.
					
					Se construyen nuevas fábricas para satisfacer la demanda interna y externa sobre los productos de industria ligera.
					
					El director de la Compañía Industrial de Rason, Ri Chol Su (51 años de edad), señaló a la ATCC que la zona económica y comercial de Rason tiene buenas condiciones para convertirse en una base de comercio y elaboración de artículos de exportación, y continuó:
					
					Nuestra compañía planea acondicionar excelentes centros de exportación que se basen en las fábricas de industria ligera modernizadas según la tecnología y equipos sofisticados.
					
					En ese sentido, se impulsa la campaña para renovar los equipos de fábricas y empresas que producen ropas, alimentos, artículos de uso diario, zapatos, materiales de empaque y otros, ampliar sus capacidades y exportar mucho más productos elaborados.
					
					Hay muchas fábricas subordinadas a nuestra compañía que exportan muchos artículos muy demandados por los nacionales y extranjeros y coproducidos con varias firmas chinas.
					
					Actualmente, las empresas de varios países del mundo desean invertir en nuestra compañía.
					
					En el futuro, nuestra compañía aportará mucho a convertir la zona económica y comercial de Rason en una base combinada de comercio y elaboración de los artículos de exportación.

articles.title: Cerrado canal de desagüe provisional de la central no. 2 de Huichon
articles.content:
Cerrado canal de desagüe provisional de la central no. 2 de Huichon
						
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedó cerrado con éxito en la Central Hidroeléctrica no. 2 de Huichon el canal de desagüe provisional tras la construcción del dique.
					Las tareas de la inmensa obra de Huichon fueron  cumplidas en casi 2 años desde el inicio. 
					
					Gracias al cierre total de dicho canal, se hizo posible retener suficientes aguas para generar la electricidad al detenerse la corriente del río Chongchon y se abrieron las perspectivas de adelantar la inauguración de la central hidroeléctrica.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la ambición de ataque preventivo nuclear de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la ambición de ataque preventivo nuclear de EE.UU.
						
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a la "amenaza nuclear y de misiles" de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, EE.UU. sigue realizando la prueba de interceptación de misiles y acordó abrir con los títeres surcoreanos la investigación sobre la cooperación militar anti-RPDC en la reunión del "comité de la política del disuasivo ampliado".
					Este hecho comprueba que EE.UU. persigue invariablemente el ataque preventivo nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					Aprovechando tal postura de EE.UU., las fuerzas hostiles a la RPDC reclaman practicar la estrategia del disuasivo ampliado en la Península Coreana y el resto de Asia Oriental.
					
					Durante el seminario auspiciado hace poco por la Fundación de la Paz Internacional Carnegie de EE.UU., un profesor de la Universidad de Keio señaló que el disuasivo ampliado forma parte de la estrategia nuclear de EE.UU. y la reelaboración del plan correspondiente por parte de este imperio y el Sur de Corea jugará un papel importante en prevenir la "provocación" de alguien.
					
					Esto es la lógica de bandido al pie de la letra.
					
					Como parte de su política de zanahoria, EE.UU. y otras fuerzas belicistas hablan superficialmente de la "distensión" de la Península Coreana, pero fortalecen en realidad la cooperación nuclear pretextando la inexistente "amenaza" de la RPDC.
					
					Entonces, viene a la mente el discurso pronunciado por el mandatario norteamericano en abril de 2009 en Praga, en el cual él juró seguir manteniendo el disuasivo efectivo para EE.UU. y sus aliados.
					
					Hace mucho tiempo, EE.UU. concretó los detalles del "disuasivo ampliado" complementando el "paraguas nuclear" ofrecido al Sur de Corea y Japón y el sistema antimisiles.
					
					Convierte el Sur de Corea y Japón como su base avanzada para el ataque preventivo nuclear y la guerra contra la RPDC.
					
					La realidad impulsa a la RPDC a consolidar más su disuasivo de guerra para defender sus máximos intereses y seguridad desde la imprudente agresión de las fuerzas hostiles.
					
					Así ella ejerce justamente su derecho a la autodefensa.

articles.title: Sesionada reunión consultiva del CPI
articles.content:
Sesionada reunión consultiva del CPI
						
Pyongyang, 13 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la reunión consultiva de los funcionarios directivos del comité preparatorio internacional (CPI) para el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					En la reunión participaron los copresidentes de ese comité: Hibrahim Mantu, ex vicepresidente del Senado de la Asamblea Nacional de Nigeria y su comitiva, Yousef Al Amiri, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad Kuwait-Corea y su comitiva, Anders Kristensen, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad Dinamarca-RPDC, y los secretarios del comité: Martin Lotscher, presidente del Comité Suiza-Corea, Zabed Ansari, secretario general de la Sucursal de Karachi de la Asociación de Amistad Pakistán-Corea, Reymond Ferguson, vicepresidente del comité preparatorio regional de Asia-Pacífico y secretario nacional de la Asociación de Amistad y Cultura Australia-RPDC, C. P. Mainali, secretario general del Comité Central del Partido Comunista Nepalés (Marxista-Leninista) y presidente del comité preparatorio nacional de Nepal, Sumiko Shimizu, presidenta del comité preparatorio de Japón y representante del Consejo de Mujeres Japonesas para la Solidaridad con las Mujeres de Corea, y Alejandro Cao De Benos, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad con Corea con sede en España y del comité preparatorio de esta entidad.
					
					También estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, quien es copresidente del CPI y presidente del comité preparatorio de Corea para la misma efeméride, la presidenta del Comité Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero (CCRCE), Kim Jong Suk, quien es vicepresidenta del comité preparatorio de Corea, el vicepresidente del CCRCE, Mun Jae Chol, quien es secretario general del comité preparatorio internacional y del comité preparatorio de Corea, y otros funcionarios.
					
					En la ocasión fueron informadas la situación de organización y trabajo de los comités preparatorios nacionales, regionales e internacional para celebrar de modo significativo el Día del Sol (15 de abril, cumpleaños del Presidente) de 2012.
					
					Según los reportes, quedaron organizados los comités preparatorios en numerosos países y regiones del mundo desde enero de 2008 cuando la Asociación de Amistad Pakistán-Corea exhortó a las entidades de amistad y solidaridad con el pueblo coreano a fundar los comités preparatorios de los países y realizar diversas actividades como los simposios, charlas, exposiciones, ediciones de libros, etc. para celebrar solemnemente el Día del Sol de 2012.
					
					También hubo el intercambio de las opiniones sobre las tareas del comité preparatorio internacional y los otros nacionales y regionales para glorificar 2012 como el año que se registre en la historia con el nombre del Presidente.
					
					Fue aprobada la resolución de la reunión que llama a conmemorar solemnemente el centenario del nacimiento del Presidente como gran fiesta histórica de la humanidad.
					
					El documento señala que la humanidad progresista y los comités preparatorios organizados en diversos países dinamizarán sus actividades para celebrar esa efeméride como gran festival político común de la humanidad y convocarán en el Día del Sol de 2012 en Pyongyang la reunión conjunta internacional en homenaje al centenario de la Corea de Kim Il Sung.
					
					Apunta que celebrarán el día de nacimiento en 2012 de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, destacado Dirigente de la causa de independencia de la humanidad, como gran festival de dimensión internacional.
					
					Subraya que apoyarán la lucha del pueblo coreano por construir una potencia próspera y reunificada para realizar el anhelo del Presidente.
					
					Al final, quedó aprobada una carta remitida al Dirigente.
